Question_1.Context: Experimental studies have been carried out to establish the possibility of using vibratory machining technology through shock-wave transmission for oxide coating preparation on aluminum-alloyed machine components.
Question_1.Question: What is the main focus of the experimental studies mentioned in the text?
Question_1.A: Improving wear resistance of machine components
Question_1.C: Enhancing the surface quality of machine components
Question_1.D: Increasing the lifespan of machine parts
Question_1.Source: The reduction of microroughness is also accompanied with good performances in terms of increasing in wear resistance and decreasing in coefficient of friction.

Question_2.Context: One of the priority areas of applied science is to develop and to introduce into production highly efficient technological processes ensuring high quality and practical use, performance, and marketability of manufactured products.
Question_2.Question: What is emphasized as a priority in applied science according to the text?
Question_2.Source: One of the priority areas of applied science is to develop and to introduce into production highly efficient technological processes ensuring high quality and practical use, performance, and marketability of manufactured products.

Question_3.Context: Coating is a method by which an artificial surface can be generated to the outer surface of the substrate material to protect it from corrosion and wear.
Question_3.Question: What is the primary purpose of applying coatings to machine components?
Question_3.Source: Coating is a method by which an artificial surface can be generated to the outer surface of the substrate material to protect it from corrosion and wear.

Question_4.Context: Machine parts manufactured by casting, forging, and other traditional manufacturing processes often require additional advanced machining operations before they can be considered ready for use or assembly.
Question_4.Question: Why do machine parts often require additional advanced machining operations?
Question_4.Source: Therefore, control over dimensional accuracy and surface finish of those components is of critical importance during any machining operation.

Question_5.Context: Nontraditional manufacturing processes is defined as a group of processes that remove excess material by various techniques involving mechanical, thermal, electrical, or chemical energy or their combination.
Question_5.Question: How is nontraditional manufacturing defined in the text?
Question_5.C: Processes involving a combination of energies
Question_5.Source: Nontraditional manufacturing processes is defined as a group of processes that remove excess material by various techniques involving mechanical, thermal, electrical, or chemical energy or their combination.

Question_6.Context: Vibratory machining as a non-conventional machining is characterized by dynamic influence of the processing medium in the form of set of impacts of its particles with the surface of the processing component part.
Question_6.Question: What characterizes vibratory machining as a non-conventional machining process?
Question_6.A: Static influence of the processing medium
Question_6.B: Dynamic influence of the processing medium
Question_6.C: Absence of impacts on the surface
Question_6.Source: Vibratory machining as a non-conventional machining is characterized by dynamic influence of the processing medium in the form of set of impacts of its particles with the surface of the processing component part.

Question_7.Context: The study of the mechanism of oxide film formation is based on the method that consist of determining arrangement pattern, sizes, and depths of processing traces when working in polyethylene balls environment.
Question_7.Question: What method is used to study the mechanism of oxide film formation on machine parts?
Question_7.Source: The study of the mechanism of oxide film formation is based on the method that consist of determining arrangement pattern, sizes, and depths of processing traces when working in polyethylene balls environment.

Question_8.Context: Experimental researches of operational characteristics were conducted on the Russian-made friction machine model СМЦ-2, by standard procedure after samples processing in vibration machine УВГ 4 × 10.
Question_8.Question: What type of machine was used for experimental research on operational characteristics?
Question_8.Source: Experimental researches of operational characteristics were conducted on the Russian-made friction machine model СМЦ-2.

Question_9.Context: Results of researches are presented on Figs. 5, 6, 7, 8, and 9.
Question_9.Question: Where are the results of the researches presented according to the text?
Question_9.Source: Results of researches are presented on Figs. 5, 6, 7, 8, and 9.

Question_10.Context: The introduction of nanodimensional structures in vibrating mecano-chemical coatings increases the efficiency of firm greasing (solid lubricants).
Question_10.Question: What effect does the introduction of nanodimensional structures have on vibrating mecano-chemical coatings?
Question_10.Source: The introduction of nanodimensional structures in vibrating mecano-chemical coatings increases the efficiency of firm greasing (solid lubricants).
